item.title: Meet Valkania, a Balkan Rhythm'n'Blues Band from London
item.description:
Meet Valkania, a Balkan Rhythm'n'Blues Band from London

The name: Valkania comes from the Greek word Βαλκάνια, meaning simply - the Balkans; it has a nice female touch to it; nothing to do with volcanoes! Residency The residency of the band is North East London Mission (style): The band was formed in 2009 with the aim to marry Balkan with Western music Not a folk band that plays traditional music.

item.title: My Perfect 24 Hours, If I Were a Teleporting Billionaire | Travel Away
item.description:
My Perfect 24 Hours, If I Were a Teleporting Billionaire | Travel Away

Bear with me on this one. Let's say it's summer, end of August to be more precise. I live in Romania, I am a billionaire, and, of course, teleportation is possible. To make it easier for you to calculate (if you want to), use the Eastern European time (UTC+2).

item.title: A Guide To Great Coffee In Kichijoji, Tokyo - Sprudge
item.description:
A Guide To Great Coffee In Kichijoji, Tokyo - Sprudge

Spring in Japan is marked by the cherry blossom, when pink clouds of the blooming flower paint on a canvas of clear blue sky. It's a time to celebrate the beautiful transience of life, which the locals often do at picnics in the park-known as -under a gentle rain of falling petals.

item.title: Headspace App Launches Personal Meditative Pods
item.description:
Headspace App Launches Personal Meditative Pods

More than five million people globally have used guided meditation service Headspace. There's an invaluable ease to using their service (especially the free app) and it has opened the doors of meditation to many. Now, the acclaimed team behind the app have produced a different sort of tool for meditation: a private nature-inspired pod made in collaboration with architect duo Oyler Wu.

item.title: High Velocity Aerial Filming
item.description:
High Velocity Aerial Filming

Aerial Filming took a giant leap forward when Blue Sky and Peter Degerfeldt challenged Gyro-stabilized Systems in Grass Valley, US, to build a GSS 520 5 axis system that would produce rock solid images at a speed of more than 300 knots per hour.
